comment: I took ART3880 with Professor Kim this semester, it was such a life-changing course. She is so knowledgeable about every topic and career that she taught the class. This course was very lecture-heavy and relied on note-taking as well. She introduced guest speakers and other helpful videos throughout the semester. A must-take for textiles for sure.

I took ART3840 with Professor Kim this semester, and she was great. She always gives great feedback that can be a little harsh at times, but that is what makes us students into the great artists we will be in the future. She is always honest and very informative when teaching us different platforms such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

Professor Kim is so experienced and knowledgeable. Her class was more group project heavy than anticipated but you can pick your group and kick out anyone who slacks on their work. Taking notes is the key to an A, so go to class. She posts the PowerPoints but gives important info in person that will be on the test. Invested in student success.

I took ART3830 with Prof. Kim and it was amazing! She is very knowledgeable about the information taught and gives great feedback + advice. Her class is majorly filled with group projects which is tough at times, but she is aware that not everyone puts in the same effort therefore grades appropriately. She was always clear on the objective, 10/10.

shes okay, nice lady- but the group assignments and projects will kill your grade, doesn't matter how well you personally are doing the group projects are the entire class and will ruin your grade since it is all group projects - especially since you cant actually meet, you are doing a massive project over face time

I don't agree with online students being paired with hybrid students. She sets it up its not spilt equally. She made expectations clear but didn't write them. If your group members didnt listen you do the tasks for them. I wrote so many long papers about nothing, the project cost time and $. We aren't in grad school so make a typical work load.

Professor Kim is fantastic if you are looking to actually learn. She will get information from the textbook but live facts as well. I learned a lot from her as she challenges students not just to know the material but to have a strong work ethic as well. She is a tough grader but prepares you for the real world.

I think she likes to gives an excessive amount of busy work. Not the best problem solver. If I went to her for help on something it was basically disregarded because she didn't like giving the full details upfront. I feel like she made a bad group situation worse. I got an A for doing my work to her standards but I didn't really learn anything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Kim is great! She seems strict at first, but really just wants to push you to your best. She grades kind of tough and will give you contructive critisicm so take it. If you don't, she will take off points.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Professor Kim is very clear about what she wants. If you provide her with the bare minimum the highest you will get is a B. She wants all her students to be creative and "go above and beyond", so if you want an A you have to put in some effort. She gives great feedback, so finish your work early and get her opinion on it.

Professor Kim is one of the best professors I've had. She truly wants you to do well in her class, IF you are willing to put in the work. She expects all of her students to put in 110% by pushing you to think outside of the box. After her class, you will feel better prepared for the industry.

Professor Kim is one of the best professors Ive ever had. She is very clear on her expectations and grades very fair. She provides all of the information and resources you will need to get an A in her class. Attendance isnt mandatory but you will miss key points if you skip. So glad I got to be in her classroom for 2 years!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very tough and strict teacher. She is not understanding at all. Her test are very difficult and her assignment are hard. She doesn't explain what she expects therefor your work will never be perfect and your grade will reflect how she feels. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Professor Kim is knowledgeable and well-connected and she brings those tools to her students. Her classes aren't easy As, but you know you're learning valuable information and truly being educated when you take a class with her. I would take her classes a million times over. My education and industry knowledge wouldn't be the same without her!

Good professor, but if you are an online student you will have it easier. They way group projects are set up, the people that don't contribute will still get As on their assignment. Refused to give full project instructions at beginning, dragged them out, making it difficult to manage time with group. Could be a bit clearer on certain details.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I didn't mind taking Kim and will have to take her again for the ATT classes. she is very helpful if you ask and care about the class. You do have to pay for adobe softwares but its worth it and youll more than likely enjoy working in at least one. She lets you redo an assignment at the end of the semester. Don't wait until the last minute on all
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Kim is awesome! She might seem strict or tough at first but her grading and expectations are very clear. She is very knowledgable in the field and lectures are not bad at all! Be sure to complete the assignments and you should do fine! Attendance is only mandatory on presentation days. Plus she has great style!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: Ms. Kim is tough but fair. It took time to get used to her but she means well. She wants all of her students to put work in to succeed. She loves details and expects lots of them. She makes it clear that you will earn your grade. She also knows people in the industry and has guest speakers.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational
